metadata.title: CVE-2022-45409 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: The garbage collector could have been aborted in several states and zonesand GCRuntime::finishCollection may not have been called,leading to a use-after-free and potentially exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.5, Thunderbird < 102.5, and Firefox< 107. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45409` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: mozjs78: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs91: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
